This verse, Kural 272, underscores the importance of inner purity over external appearances. The verse emphasizes the idea that true piety and morality are not about external displays of sanctity, but about the purity and righteousness of the mind and heart. It warns against hypocrisy, where people put on a facade of being virtuous while harboring sinful thoughts and intentions internally.
